connector.description: Sending and receive messages to/from AWS SQS service using AWS SDK version 2.x.

camel.sink.endpoint.amazonAWSHost.name: camel.sink.endpoint.amazonAWSHost
camel.sink.endpoint.amazonAWSHost.description: The hostname of the Amazon AWS cloud.

camel.sink.endpoint.amazonSQSClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.amazonSQSClient
camel.sink.endpoint.amazonSQSClient.description: To use the AmazonSQS as client

camel.sink.endpoint.autoCreateQueue.name: camel.sink.endpoint.autoCreateQueue
camel.sink.endpoint.autoCreateQueue.description: Setting the autocreation of the queue

camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy.name: camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy
camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to map headers to/from Camel.

camel.sink.endpoint.overrideEndpoint.name: camel.sink.endpoint.overrideEndpoint
camel.sink.endpoint.overrideEndpoint.description: Set the need for overidding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride option

camel.sink.endpoint.protocol.name: camel.sink.endpoint.protocol
camel.sink.endpoint.protocol.description: The underlying protocol used to communicate with SQS

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the SQS client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.sink.endpoint.queueOwnerAWSAccount.name: camel.sink.endpoint.queueOwnerAWSAccountId
camel.sink.endpoint.queueOwnerAWSAccount.description: Specify the queue owner aws account id when you need to connect the queue with different account owner.

camel.sink.endpoint.region.name: camel.sink.endpoint.region
camel.sink.endpoint.region.description: The region in which SQS client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

camel.sink.endpoint.trustAllCertificates.name: camel.sink.endpoint.trustAllCertificates
camel.sink.endpoint.trustAllCertificates.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

camel.sink.endpoint.uriEndpointOverride.name: camel.sink.endpoint.uriEndpointOverride
camel.sink.endpoint.uriEndpointOverride.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

camel.sink.endpoint.useDefaultCredential.name: camel.sink.endpoint.useDefaultCredentialsProvider
camel.sink.endpoint.useDefaultCredential.description: Set whether the SQS client should expect to load credentials on an AWS infra instance or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

camel.sink.endpoint.batchSeparator.name: camel.sink.endpoint.batchSeparator
camel.sink.endpoint.batchSeparator.description: Set the separator when passing a String to send batch message operation

camel.sink.endpoint.delaySeconds.name: camel.sink.endpoint.delaySeconds
camel.sink.endpoint.delaySeconds.description: Delay sending messages for a number of seconds.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.messageDeduplication.name: camel.sink.endpoint.messageDeduplicationIdStrategy
camel.sink.endpoint.messageDeduplication.description: Only for FIFO queues. Strategy for setting the messageDeduplicationId on the message. Can be one of the following options: useExchangeId, useContentBasedDeduplication. For the useContentBasedDeduplication option, no messageDeduplicationId will be set on the message. One of: [useExchangeId] [useContentBasedDeduplication]

camel.sink.endpoint.messageGroupIdStrate.name: camel.sink.endpoint.messageGroupIdStrategy
camel.sink.endpoint.messageGroupIdStrate.description: Only for FIFO queues. Strategy for setting the messageGroupId on the message. Can be one of the following options: useConstant, useExchangeId, usePropertyValue. For the usePropertyValue option, the value of property CamelAwsMessageGroupId will be used. One of: [useConstant] [useExchangeId] [usePropertyValue]

camel.sink.endpoint.operation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.operation
camel.sink.endpoint.operation.description: The operation to do in case the user don't want to send only a message One of: [sendBatchMessage] [deleteMessage] [listQueues] [purgeQueue]

camel.sink.endpoint.delayQueue.name: camel.sink.endpoint.delayQueue
camel.sink.endpoint.delayQueue.description: Define if you want to apply delaySeconds option to the queue or on single messages

camel.sink.endpoint.queueUrl.name: camel.sink.endpoint.queueUrl
camel.sink.endpoint.queueUrl.description: To define the queueUrl explicitly. All other parameters, which would influence the queueUrl, are ignored. This parameter is intended to be used, to connect to a mock implementation of SQS, for testing purposes.

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the SQS client

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the SQS client

camel.sink.endpoint.maximumMessageSize.name: camel.sink.endpoint.maximumMessageSize
camel.sink.endpoint.maximumMessageSize.description: The maximumMessageSize (in bytes) an SQS message can contain for this queue.

camel.sink.endpoint.messageRetentionPeri.name: camel.sink.endpoint.messageRetentionPeriod
camel.sink.endpoint.messageRetentionPeri.description: The messageRetentionPeriod (in seconds) a message will be retained by SQS for this queue.

camel.sink.endpoint.policy.name: camel.sink.endpoint.policy
camel.sink.endpoint.policy.description: The policy for this queue. It can be loaded by default from classpath, but you can prefix with classpath:, file:, or http: to load the resource from different systems.

camel.sink.endpoint.receiveMessageWaitTi.name: camel.sink.endpoint.receiveMessageWaitTimeSeconds
camel.sink.endpoint.receiveMessageWaitTi.description: If you do not specify WaitTimeSeconds in the request, the queue attribute ReceiveMessageWaitTimeSeconds is used to determine how long to wait.

camel.sink.endpoint.redrivePolicy.name: camel.sink.endpoint.redrivePolicy
camel.sink.endpoint.redrivePolicy.description: Specify the policy that send message to DeadLetter queue. See detail at Amazon docs.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.amazonAWSHost.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.amazonAWSHost
camel.component.aws2-sqs.amazonAWSHost.description: The hostname of the Amazon AWS cloud.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.amazonSQSClient.description: To use the AmazonSQS as client

camel.component.aws2-sqs.autoCreateQueue.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.autoCreateQueue
camel.component.aws2-sqs.autoCreateQueue.description: Setting the autocreation of the queue

camel.component.aws2-sqs.overrideEndpoin.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.overrideEndpoint
camel.component.aws2-sqs.overrideEndpoin.description: Set the need for overidding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride option

camel.component.aws2-sqs.protocol.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.protocol
camel.component.aws2-sqs.protocol.description: The underlying protocol used to communicate with SQS

camel.component.aws2-sqs.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the SQS client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.component.aws2-sqs.queueOwnerAWSAc.description: Specify the queue owner aws account id when you need to connect the queue with different account owner.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.region.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.region
camel.component.aws2-sqs.region.description: The region in which SQS client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

camel.component.aws2-sqs.trustAllCertifi.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.trustAllCertificates
camel.component.aws2-sqs.trustAllCertifi.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

camel.component.aws2-sqs.uriEndpointOver.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.uriEndpointOverride
camel.component.aws2-sqs.uriEndpointOver.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

camel.component.aws2-sqs.useDefaultCrede.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.useDefaultCredentialsProvider
camel.component.aws2-sqs.useDefaultCrede.description: Set whether the SQS client should expect to load credentials on an AWS infra instance or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.batchSeparator.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.batchSeparator
camel.component.aws2-sqs.batchSeparator.description: Set the separator when passing a String to send batch message operation

camel.component.aws2-sqs.delaySeconds.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.delaySeconds
camel.component.aws2-sqs.delaySeconds.description: Delay sending messages for a number of seconds.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.lazyStartProduc.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.aws2-sqs.lazyStartProduc.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.messageDeduplic.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.messageDeduplicationIdStrategy
camel.component.aws2-sqs.messageDeduplic.description: Only for FIFO queues. Strategy for setting the messageDeduplicationId on the message. Can be one of the following options: useExchangeId, useContentBasedDeduplication. For the useContentBasedDeduplication option, no messageDeduplicationId will be set on the message. One of: [useExchangeId] [useContentBasedDeduplication]

camel.component.aws2-sqs.messageGroupIdS.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.messageGroupIdStrategy
camel.component.aws2-sqs.messageGroupIdS.description: Only for FIFO queues. Strategy for setting the messageGroupId on the message. Can be one of the following options: useConstant, useExchangeId, usePropertyValue. For the usePropertyValue option, the value of property CamelAwsMessageGroupId will be used. One of: [useConstant] [useExchangeId] [usePropertyValue]

camel.component.aws2-sqs.operation.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.operation
camel.component.aws2-sqs.operation.description: The operation to do in case the user don't want to send only a message One of: [sendBatchMessage] [deleteMessage] [listQueues] [purgeQueue]

camel.component.aws2-sqs.autowiredEnable.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.aws2-sqs.autowiredEnable.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.delayQueue.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.delayQueue
camel.component.aws2-sqs.delayQueue.description: Define if you want to apply delaySeconds option to the queue or on single messages

camel.component.aws2-sqs.queueUrl.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.queueUrl
camel.component.aws2-sqs.queueUrl.description: To define the queueUrl explicitly. All other parameters, which would influence the queueUrl, are ignored. This parameter is intended to be used, to connect to a mock implementation of SQS, for testing purposes.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.proxyHost.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.proxyHost
camel.component.aws2-sqs.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the SQS client

camel.component.aws2-sqs.proxyPort.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.proxyPort
camel.component.aws2-sqs.proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the SQS client

camel.component.aws2-sqs.maximumMessageS.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.maximumMessageSize
camel.component.aws2-sqs.maximumMessageS.description: The maximumMessageSize (in bytes) an SQS message can contain for this queue.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.messageRetentio.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.messageRetentionPeriod
camel.component.aws2-sqs.messageRetentio.description: The messageRetentionPeriod (in seconds) a message will be retained by SQS for this queue.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.policy.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.policy
camel.component.aws2-sqs.policy.description: The policy for this queue. It can be loaded by default from classpath, but you can prefix with classpath:, file:, or http: to load the resource from different systems.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.receiveMessageW.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.receiveMessageWaitTimeSeconds
camel.component.aws2-sqs.receiveMessageW.description: If you do not specify WaitTimeSeconds in the request, the queue attribute ReceiveMessageWaitTimeSeconds is used to determine how long to wait.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.redrivePolicy.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.redrivePolicy
camel.component.aws2-sqs.redrivePolicy.description: Specify the policy that send message to DeadLetter queue. See detail at Amazon docs.
